item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: A Tragic End to a Promising Beginning
item.itunes:title: A Tragic End to a Promising Beginning
item.description:
Why did God forgive David but ultimately reject Saul as king? Dr. Stanley illuminates the key difference between the two kings. Saul’s end was tragic, but you can learn how to avoid his fate.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: The Blessings of God
item.itunes:title: The Blessings of God
item.description:
When we say "bless you" to someone, what do we really mean? Oftentimes, we use the word "bless" very carelessly. However, we have the opportunity to bless God, bless others, and even things (like a worship service) if God approves of them and is involved in them.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
When we say "bless you" to someone, what do we really mean? Oftentimes, we use the word "bless" very carelessly. However, we have the opportunity to bless God, bless others, and even things (like a worship service) if God approves of them and is involved in them.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Key to Contentment - Part 2
item.itunes:title: The Key to Contentment - Part 2
item.description:

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: The Danger of Anger - Part 2
item.itunes:title: The Danger of Anger - Part 2
item.description:
Most people believe they have a right to feel bitter until their situations improve. But our heavenly Father wants us to enjoy peace and joy, regardless of our circumstances. Dr. Stanley discusses how to manage your anger God's way after listing out the benefits, aspects, and causes of anger.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: A Promising Beginning
item.itunes:title: A Promising Beginning
item.description:
One of the most tragic figures in the Bible is King Saul. What can we learn from a life that began with such promise only to end so badly? Dr. Stanley gives a solemn warning—even seemingly small acts of disobedience can derail us from accomplishing God’s will.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
One of the most tragic figures in the Bible is King Saul. What can we learn from a life that began with such promise only to end so badly? Dr. Stanley gives a solemn warning—even seemingly small acts of disobedience can derail us from accomplishing God’s will.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Life’s Number One Priority
item.itunes:title: Life’s Number One Priority

item.title: Finding Clear Guidance - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Finding Clear Guidance - Part 2
item.description:
How do you feel when you have to make major life decisions? You don't have to make these decisions alone—God wants to give you clear direction. Dr. Stanley shares the principles necessary to making right decisions.

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: The Pursuit of God - Part 2
item.itunes:title: The Pursuit of God - Part 2
item.description:
How often have you attained something worldly and found it completely fulfilled all your hopes and dreams? Even if it did satisfy in the moment, how long before another desire began to capture your attention? Learn to shift your focus to the eternal things that really matter.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Understanding the Call of God - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Understanding the Call of God - Part 2
item.description:
Dr. Stanley talks about the four types of calls that God issues to His people: salvation, sanctification, service, and accountability. The question isn’t, "Is God calling me?" It’s, "Am I listening?"

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: The God of All Comfort - Part 2
item.itunes:title: The God of All Comfort - Part 2
item.description:
God is called by many names in the Bible, but one of the most comprehensive is the name "I Am." God has many titles that remind us of His attributes and can encourage us when we face difficult circumstances. Dr. Stanley uses the life of Paul to illustrate that God truly is the God of all comfort.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: Resistance to Commitment - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Resistance to Commitment - Part 2
item.description:
Jonah is the perfect example of a man who knew God's calling, yet resisted it anyway. Similarly, there are some things we have no problem handing over to Christ. But when it comes to others, we can't let go. Dr. Stanley encourages us to address the areas we haven't surrendered to God.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: Motivation for Commitment - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Motivation for Commitment - Part 2
item.description:
Motivation is the driving force within us. It’s the difference between simply living and living an abundant life. But what is it that motivates the people of God? Dr. Stanley prompts our thinking about what drives us to fulfill the commitments we made to God by sharing the story of Daniel.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

Donate: https://store.intouch.org/donate/general

item.itunes:title: Understanding the Call of God - Part 1
item.description:

item.itunes:author: Dr. Charles Stanley

item.title: Motivation for Commitment - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Motivation for Commitment - Part 1
item.description:
Motivation is the driving force within us. It’s the difference between simply living and living an abundant life. But what is it that motivates the people of God? Dr. Stanley prompts our thinking about what drives us to fulfill the commitments we made to God by sharing the story of Daniel.

item.title: Commitment on Trial - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Commitment on Trial - Part 2
item.description:
No matter how committed you are to Christ, your loyalty will be tested. Abraham faced the most difficult test a father could face—being asked to sacrifice his son. Abraham’s story is a great example of how trials can strengthen our commitment to God.

The power of Christ in us is enough because if we trust in Him, our lives will reflect God’s goodness.
